metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Java Syntax
Java Syntax
In the previous chapter, we created a Java file called Main.java , and we used the following code to print "Hello World" to the screen:
content.html: In the previous chapter, we created a Java file called Main.java, and we used the following code to print "Hello World" to the screen:

content.code_html:
public class Main {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println("Hello World");
  }
}

content.text: Example explained
Every line of code that runs in Java must be inside a class . And the class name should always start with an uppercase first letter. In our example, we named the class Main .
content.html: Every line of code that runs in Java must be inside a class. And the class name should always start with an uppercase first letter. In our example, we named the class Main.

content.text: Note: Java is case-sensitive: "MyClass" and "myclass" has different meaning.
content.html: Note: Java is case-sensitive: "MyClass" and "myclass" has different meaning.

content.text: The name of the java file must match the class name. When saving the file, save it using the class name and add ".java" to the end of the filename. To run the example above on your computer, make sure that Java is properly installed: Go to the Get Started Chapter for how to install Java. The output should be:
content.html: The name of the java file must match the class name. When saving the file, save it using the class name and add ".java" to the end of the filename. To run the example above on your computer, make sure that Java is properly installed: Go to the Get Started Chapter for how to install Java. The output should be:

content.code_html: Hello World

content.text: The main Method
The main() method is required and you will see it in every Java program:
content.html: The main() method is required and you will see it in every Java program:

content.code:
public

static

void

main
(
String
[
]
args
)
content.code_html: public static void main(String[] args)

content.text: Any code inside the main() method will be executed. Don't worry about the keywords before and after it. You will get to know them bit by bit while reading this tutorial.
content.html: Any code inside the main() method will be executed. Don't worry about the keywords before and after it. You will get to know them bit by bit while reading this tutorial.

content.text: For now, just remember that every Java program has a class name which must match the filename, and that every program must contain the main() method.
content.html: For now, just remember that every Java program has a class name which must match the filename, and that every program must contain the main() method.

content.text: System.out.println()
Inside the main() method, we can use the println() method to print a line of text to the screen:
content.html: Inside the main() method, we can use the println() method to print a line of text to the screen:

content.code:
public

static

void

main
(
String
[
]
args
)

{


System
.
out
.
println
(
"Hello World"
)
;


}
content.code_html:
public static void main(String[] args) {
  System.out.println("Hello World");
}

content.text: Note: The curly braces {} marks the beginning and the end of a block of code.
content.html: Note: The curly braces {} marks the beginning and the end of a block of code.

content.text: System is a built-in Java class that contains useful members, such as out , which is short for "output". The println() method, short for "print line", is used to print a value to the screen (or a file).
content.html: System is a built-in Java class that contains useful members, such as out, which is short for "output". The println() method, short for "print line", is used to print a value to the screen (or a file).

content.text: Don't worry too much about how System , out and println() works. Just know that you need them together to print stuff to the screen.
content.html: Don't worry too much about how System, out and println() works. Just know that you need them together to print stuff to the screen.

content.text: You should also note that each code statement must end with a semicolon ( ; ).
content.html: You should also note that each code statement must end with a semicolon (;).
